Brief overview of gene set: The genes in this gene set are all involved in the mitochondrial respiratory chain, specifically in the electron transport chain and oxidative phosphorylation. They encode subunits of Complex I (NADH dehydrogenase), Complex III (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase), and Complex IV (cytochrome c oxidase), as well as the ATP synthase complex. These genes are essential for the generation of ATP, the energy currency of the cell.

Upstream pathways may affect this gene set: Perturbations in the TCA cycle, fatty acid oxidation, and other metabolic pathways that generate NADH and FADH2 could impact the expression of these genes. Additionally, mutations or defects in the mitochondrial DNA or nuclear-encoded mitochondrial genes could also affect the expression and function of these genes.

Name of gene set: Mitochondrial respiratory chain genes
[End of Output]
